column1: 1 ^ Laĕtátus sum in hîs qŭaĕ dicta sunt mìchi
column2: «~In domum Dòmini íbimus.~»^ I rejoiced at the things that were said to me
column3: "We shall go into the house of the Lord."

column1: 2 ^ Stantes èrant pèdes nostri in átriîs tuîs
column2: Jerúsalim. ^ Our feet were standing in thy courts

column3: cujus participáțio ejus in idìpsum. ^ Jerusalem
column4: which is built as a city
ad confitèndum nómini Dòmini. ^ For thither did the tribes go up
column7: to praise the name of the Lord.

column1: 5 ^ Qŭia illic sêdérunt sedes in judìcio
column2: sedes super domum Davídis. ^ Because their seats have sat in judgment
column3: seats upon the house of David.

column1: 6 ^ Rogáte qŭaĕ ad pacem sunt Jerusalímis
column2: et abundánția diliģèntibus te. ^ Pray ye for the things that are to the peace of Jerusalem
column3: and abundance for them that love thee.

column2: et abundánția in tùrribus tuîs. ^ Let peace be in thy strength

column1: 8 ^ Pròpter fratres meos et pròximos meos
column2: loqŭébar pacem de te. ^ For the sake of my brethren
qŭaĕsívi bona tìbi. ^ Because of the house of the Lord our God
column3: I have sought good things for thee.
